Add Spatial Point Data Layer with Color by Grouping

Source: R/geom_loc.R
geom_loc.Rd

geom_loc is a flexible function that adds spatial data to a ggplot, supporting both sf and tabular data frames. It allows color mapping based on a grouping variable in the data.

Usage

geom_loc(
  data,
  lon = NULL,
  lat = NULL,
  crs = "+proj=aeqd +lat_0=35 +lon_0=105 +ellps=WGS84 +units=m +no_defs",
  mapping = aes(),
  ...
)

Arguments

data

A data frame, tibble, or sf object.

lon

Character. The name of the longitude column in data (required if data is tabular).

lat

Character. The name of the latitude column in data (required if data is tabular).

crs

Character. Coordinate reference system (CRS) to which the data should be transformed. Defaults to "+proj=aeqd +lat_0=35 +lon_0=105 +ellps=WGS84 +units=m +no_defs".

mapping

Aesthetic mappings created by aes(), such as color.

...

Additional aesthetic mappings passed to geom_sf, such as size, alpha.

Value

A ggplot layer displaying spatial data as points in the specified CRS.

Examples

# Example with tabular data from the package
data(pollen) # Load the example data provided by the package
ggplot() +
  geom_loc(
    data = pollen, lon = "Longitude", lat = "Latitude",
    mapping = aes(color = `Sample type`), size = 1, alpha = 0.7
  ) +
  labs(title = "Sample Points on Map")
#> Linking to GEOS 3.11.2, GDAL 3.8.2, PROJ 9.3.1; sf_use_s2() is TRUE
